title: BOLD Annual Wine Social
location: 10000 Avalon Blvd., Suite 100 Alpharetta, GA 30009, USA
description: Our annual BOLD Wine Social is a signature event featuring connection over wine, delicious bites from Three Sisters Catering , and support for North Fulton businesses who champion women in the workplace. The event's main demographic is businesswomen, but we always invite our businessmen counterpoints to join us and support their colleagues. This is a perfect sponsorship opportunity if your business's main clientele is women and your chance to show your employees a great evening out. So whether you want an exhibit table to show off your brand or want to treat your team to a fun time - check out the sponsorships that would be right for you. VIP tickets that include the evening's swag bag are available exclusively through sponsorship and for the first 100 sponsor attendees registered. Sponsorships start at just $300. Silent Auction Items: - 2 tickets to Yacht Rock Holiday Revue at the Coca-Cola Roxy ($300 value) from Live Nation - 2 Deluxe Seats Wizard of Oz tickets at City Springs, from City Springs Theatre Company - 2 VIP tickets to the Annual Tree Lighting, from Avalon - One Night Stay from the Hotel at Avalon - $300 Gaming Card, from Activate Games

title: Brickmont at Roswell Ribbon Cutting
location: 10000 Avalon Blvd., Suite 100 Alpharetta, GA 30009, USA
description: Join us in celebrating the ribbon cutting of Brickmont at Roswell 2650 Holcomb Bridge Road Alpharetta, GA 30022 Thursday, November 6th, 3pm What is Brickmont at Roswell? This senior community is nestled in a welcoming setting in Roswell, Georgia, conveniently located off Holcomb Bridge Road, near Vickery Creek Falls, Dunwoody Country Club, and the Chattahoochee Nature Center. They offer comfortable apartments, a rich collection of amenities, and a variety of daily activities and entertainment. The highly-trained and compassionate team is committed to ensuring that the residents feel loved and welcomed, backed by the best senior care available from our dedicated caregiving professionals. description: Join us for a tailgate edition of Business After Hours (BAH)! BAH consistently proves to be the ultimate way to wrap up your busy work day. title: NextGen Connect & Caffeinate at Just Love Coffee & Cafe
location: 10000 Avalon Blvd., Suite 100 Alpharetta, GA 30009, USA
description: Join other North Fulton young professionals for networking, coffee, and breakfast at the Greater North Futon Chamber for NextGen Connect & Caffeinate. Build relationships, invest in your own professional development, and develop leads with us. Event registration includes coffee and is open to both Chamber members and non-members. NextGen Connects is a Chamber talent development initiative that serves to engage, recognize, and develop the Greater North Fulton Chamber of Commerce’s future leaders. This young professionals group is designed for individuals, ages 21 to 40, who are living and/or working in North Fulton. Interested in sponsoring or hosting a NextGen Connect & Caffeinate or After Hours event? ﻿Contact Christy Hulsey to invest in North Fulton's future today: chulsey@gnfcc.com Events News Sponsorship Opportunities Join Membership Levels Member Benefits Member Directory

title: NextGen Connects After Hours at Activate Games
location: 10000 Avalon Blvd., Suite 100 Alpharetta, GA 30009, USA
description: Join us for an electrifying evening of fun, networking, and friendly competition at Activate Games in Alpharetta! This high-tech, team-based experience is perfect for young professionals looking to connect, unwind, and challenge themselves in immersive game rooms. Whether you're new to NextGen or a regular, this is your chance to level up your connections—after hours! What is Activate? Activate Games is a high-tech, interactive gaming facility where players become part of the action—jumping, climbing, solving puzzles, and dodging lasers in immersive game rooms that test both physical and mental agility. Learn more: https://playactivate.com/ Thank you to our Connect After Hours Series Sponsors for a great year: 5:30 - 7:00 p.m. Events News

title: North Fulton Focus Series- Entrepreneurship
location: 10000 Avalon Blvd., Suite 100 Alpharetta, GA 30009, USA
description: GNFCC has its FOCUS on growing talent, empowering small business, and cultivating innovation right here in North Fulton. Talent shows up in many ways and it takes an ecosystem of creativity, business acumen, and access to resources to launch and grow companies. This opportunity highlights successful companies including our Small Business Awards focusing on the backbone of our economy. $55 for Members $75 for Non-Members Events News Sponsorship Opportunities Join Membership Levels Member Benefits Member Directory Investors We proudly accept: Refund Policy 10000 Avalon Blvd., Suite 100 Alpharetta, GA 30009, USA

title: ProAlliance Networking Meeting
location: 10000 Avalon Blvd., Suite 100 Alpharetta, GA 30009, USA
description: You are invited to be a part of one of the largest networking groups in North Fulton. Build relationships, support professional development, and develop leads. This is an opportunity to network with other Chamber members and guests, share ideas, and grow your business. What to Expect: - Be prepared to speak for ~2 minutes to share more about yourself in a small group setting - Enjoy 6-minute presentations from two GNFCC members (all Chamber Members are eligible) - Be prepared to stand and give a ~25 second elevator pitch to all guests - Opportunity to donate swag items to giveaway to the crowd (simply bring item with you and give to facilitator) Please register by 4pm on the Tuesday prior to the meeting prior to be on the registration list. You may register until the start of the meeting at 7:30am. Registration is required for this event. ProAlliance Coffee Sponsor: 7:30am - 7:45am - Networking 7:45am - Meeting Begins 9:00am – Meeting Concludes Events News

title: Strategic Leadership Visit
location: 10000 Avalon Blvd., Suite 100 Alpharetta, GA 30009, USA
description: The Greater North Fulton Chamber’s Strategic Leadership Visit brings together 40 top leaders from government, business, and education to explore bold ideas and breakthrough initiatives driving success in other communities. Designed to spark collaboration and inspire action, this high-impact trip fosters powerful connections among North Fulton and metro Atlanta leaders—laying the groundwork for transformative progress back home. We will be exploring the cities of Scottsdale and Mesa, Arizona- cities known for their innovative approaches to economic development, regional collaboration, smart infrastructure, and arts and tourism investment. This fast-growing, future-focused area offers valuable insights and inspiration as North Fulton continues to shape its own path forward. title: Scares on the Square~ Scarecrows in Downtown Dahlonega
description: Scares on the Square~ Scarecrows in Downtown Dahlonega For the second year of Scares on the Square, we’re taking the scarecrows to the shops. Build and display a scarecrow in front of your business (remember, of course, to secure your scarecrow to a base and leave at least 3’ of sidewalk walking space around your scarecrow) for the month of October. No fee to enter, but send us your location so we can add you to our viewing map that will be available for visitors and photo opportunities. title: Business After Hours - Bennett Farms

description: Business After Hours October 23, 2025 5:00 - 7:00 PM 4593 Mt Vernon Rd Gainesville, GA 30506 Join us to get an inside look at the beautiful Bennett Farms! Nestled on 65 acres in the rolling hills of northern Hall County, Bennett Farms began as a family dream—a beloved gathering place for celebrations and community. With every detail thoughtfully designed and locally sourced, the venue tells a story of hospitality, heritage, and heart. Whether it’s a wedding, reunion, or festive event, guests come for the charm—and leave with lasting memories. Enjoy light bites, beverages, and networking! description: Business Showcase Tuesday, February 24, 2026 2:00 - 5:00 PM Gainesville Civic Center REGISTER HERE Discover the heartbeat of our local economy at the Business Showcase , where businesses from across the region come together to highlight their products, services, and innovations. Browse booths, make connections, and see what makes our local business community thrive. Then stick around for the Showcase Social from 5–7 PM to keep the conversations going over food, drinks, and good company! title: Farm City Breakfast
location: 4175 Nopone Rd Gainesville ,
description: Farm City Breakfast Tuesday November 18, 2025 7:30am North Hall Community Center This event highlights agribusiness is the Hall County area and is a partnership between the UGA/Hall County Extension, Georgia Farm Bureau and the Greater Hall Chamber of Commerce. This years special guest is Anthony (Tony) Llano- Director, Industry Partnerships & Project-Based Learning University of Georgia College of Agricultural & Environmental Sciences (CAES). Mr. Llano will be talking about UGA's Grand Farm; a working innovation farm. The 250-acre site will be a hub for agricultural innovation projects, demonstrating new technologies and automation focused on specialty crops from Georgia and the Southeast. The first projects are set to go live this year. To register for this event please call Karen Davis at the Hall County Extension office at 770-535-8293 230 E.E. Butler Parkway Gainesville, GA 30501 | Phone: (770) 532-6206

title: Health & Wellness Seminar - Registered Hands Only: Why Credentials Matter in Medical Imaging"
description: J oin Erika Bongart with Lanier Technical College to learn more about Radiology Technicians and why their role is so important to healthcare. About the presentation : Medical imaging is a vital part of diagnosing everything from broken bones to cancer…but not all imaging is equal. This presentation shines a light on the essential role of Registered Radiologic Technologists, who are Nationally certified experts in safely and accurately producing medical images. Learn how their training in anatomy, radiation safety, and technology ensures the highest standard of care. This presentation explores why choosing credentialed professionals protects patients and supports accurate diagnoses—because when it comes to your health, who takes your image matters. About the speaker : Erika Bongart is a Registered Radiologic Technologist and the Program Director for the Radiologic Technology Associate Degree program at Lanier Technical College. Erika been a member of the Lanier Technical College faculty since 2019, and specializes in pediatric medical imaging. Erika is a proud alumnus of LTC, where she earned an Associate of Applied Science degree in Radiologic Technology. She was awarded a Bachelor

title: Health & Wellness Seminar - “When Caregiving Gets Legal: What Families Need to Know Before It’s Too Late”
description: Join Josh Nelson with Nelson Elder Care Law to discuss "When Caregiving Gets Legal: What Families Need to Know Before It’s Too Late". Presentation Bio: Caring for an aging parent or loved one is more than just doctor visits and daily support; it often means stepping into unexpected legal territory. Having the right legal tools can make the difference between smooth decision-making and costly court battles. In this session, Josh Nelson will share practical insights on the legal tools every caregiver should have in place and how families can avoid the most common pitfalls. Speaker Bio: Josh Nelson, JD, is the CEO and Owner of Nelson Elder Care Law. With advanced training in both law and taxation, he has spent over a decade helping Georgia families protect their loved ones and their assets during life’s most difficult transitions. Since founding his firm in 2014, Josh has guided more than 7,000 families through the legal and financial challenges of caring for aging parents. As Vice Chair of the Elder Law Section of the State Bar of Georgia, he frequently speaks to caregivers, professionals, and community groups about the practical steps families can take to reduce stress, prevent cris

title: Small Business Seminar - “OBBA Unpacked: What the One Big Beautiful Bill Means for You”
description: Join Christina Page & Jennifer Pazdzior from Rushton to unpack the One Big Beautiful Bill and what it means for your small business. Presentation Overview: A clear, practical look at how the sweeping OBBA legislation affects everyday individuals and small business owners. We’ll break down what’s changing, what’s staying the same, and what it all means for your financial future. If you would like to attend on zoom, please register via the registration button. An email will be sent prior to the seminar with a zoom link. 230 E.E. Butler Parkway Gainesville, GA 30501 | Phone: (770) 532-6206
